subject: Creativity
title: Humor Across Cultures: Why Some Jokes Don't Translate
description: A short lesson to help you apply Humor Across Cultures: Why Some Jokes Don't Translate.

hook.text: Germans love slapstick. British prefer dry wit. Japanese love 'manzai' (a duo comedy with a straight man and funny man).

buildup.text: A study asked people in 26 countries to rate the world's funniest joke.

discovery.text: High-context cultures (Japan) prefer subtle, situational humor.

twist.text: Some things ARE universal: babies laughing at peekaboo, slapstick physical comedy, and surprise-based humor.

climax.text: The globalization of memes is creating a new 'internet humor culture' â€” young people worldwide share comedic references.

punchline.text: Humor is universal. Jokes are cultural. The difference matters.

quiz.question: Why don't all jokes translate across cultures?
options: Humor reflects cultural communication styles and context
